resources:
Module 1 Overview of Operating System Operating System Objectives and Functions The Evolution of Operating Systems Operating System Structures System Calls Developments Leading to Modern Operating Systems Virtual Machines
Module 2 Process Management Process: Concept of a Process Process States Process Description Execution of the Operating System Threads: Processes and Threads Concept of Multithreading Types of Threads Thread programming Using Pthreads Scheduling: CPU Scheduling Thread Scheduling
Module 3 Concurrency Control and Deadlock Handling Concurrency Control: Principles of Concurrency Requirements for Mutual Exclusion Mutual Exclusion Hardware Support Operating System Support (Semaphores and Mutex) Programming Language Support (Monitors) Classical synchronization problems Readers/Writers Problem Producer and Consumer problem Inter-process communication Deadlock: Principles of Deadlock Deadlock Modeling Strategies to deal with deadlock: The Ostrich Algorithm
Module 4 Memory Management Memory Management: Memory Management Requirements Memory Partitioning: Fixed Partitioning, Dynamic Partitioning, Buddy System, Relocation, Paging, Segmentation Virtual Memory: What is Virtual Memory Demand Paging Page Replacement Allocation Allocating Kernel Memory
Module 5 Input / Output And File Management I/O Management and Disk Scheduling: I/O Devices Organization of the I/O Function Operating System Design Issues I/O Buffering Disk Scheduling(FIFO, SSTF, SCAN, C-SCAN, LOOK, C-LOOK) Disk Cache File Management: Overview File Organization and Access File Directories File Sharing Record Blocking Secondary Storage Management
Module 6 Case Study: LINUX Operating System--> Overview of Linux Architecture Process management Memory Management I/O Management Basic shell commands Shell as a scripting language
Practicals Operating Systems Practicals Practical 1 - Explore LINUX Commands (Basic and Advanced) Practical 2 - Write a program to implement any two CPU scheduling algorithms like FCFS, SJF, Round Robin etc. Practical 3 - Write a program to implement Dinning Philosopher Problem Practical 4 - Write a program to implement Bankerâ€™s algorithm. Practical 5 - Build a program to implement FIFO and LRU page replacement policies Practical 6 - Practical 6 - Build a program to implement SRTF and Priority page replacement policies Practical 7 - Develop a program to implement dynamic partitioning placement algorithms Practical 8 - Build a program to implement FCFS and SSTF disk scheduling algorithm Case Study - \n\t 1. Windows Operating System.\n 2. LINUX Operating System.\n 3. Multiprocessor Scheduling and Linux Scheduling\n
